Title: Senior Lead Analytics Consultant (SAS & SQL)
CompanyDetails: Wells Fargo ¬∑ Taguig, National Capital Region, Philippines Reposted 2 weeks ago ¬∑ 7 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
About Wells Fargo India & Philippines

Wells Fargo India & Philippines is a critical component of Wells Fargo's strategy to leverage distinct advantages in doing business in a global environment. Wells Fargo India & Philippines is primarily an extension of the technology, operations, and corporate support teams of Wells Fargo. It engages in application development and support, testing, other technology functions, international operations, knowledge support, and middle and back-end banking process solutions for a wide spectrum of Wells Fargo's needs. It currently has offices in Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, and Manila.

Department Overview

Risk Analytics, Monitoring & Surveillance (RAMS) transforms risk management across Consumer Banking through use of actionable data and observations to monitor a wide range of risks with emphasis on conduct, compliance, and operational risks through a risk-based supervision program. This program provides necessary monitoring to support a strong control environment across Consumer Banking and empowers our team members as accountable risk managers.

About This Role

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Lead Analytics Consultant.

In This Role, You Will

Act as an advisor to senior leadership to develop or influence analytical strategies for highly complex business and technical needs
Lead the strategy and resolution of highly complex and unique challenges requiring analytical application of industry techniques and advanced data from multiple sources across the enterprise
Deliver solutions that are long-term, large-scale, and require vision, innovation, and coordination of highly complex activities
Provide vision, direction, and expertise to senior leadership on implementing innovative and significant business solutions that align to the enterprise
Ensure adherence to compliance and legal regulations and policies on all projects managed
Strategically engage with all levels of professionals and managers across the enterprise and serve as an expert advisor to leadership

Required Qualifications:

7+ years of Analytics, Reporting, Financial Modeling or Statistics experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

Desired Qualifications:

Candidate must be a graduate of a B.A./B.S. course in College (preferably in Applied Math, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Econometrics, Computer Sciences
Knowledge in: SAS, SQL, Database Management, Project Management, Requirements Elicitation and Documentation, Development and Testing
10+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling using SAS & SQL
Minimum 8+ years' experience in SAS programming
Banking experience is an advantage

Job Expectations:

Participate in the daily operations of Monitoring Execution team for risk detection strategy development, testing and implementation that will support new and existing monitoring strategy development and execution as well as support the CBAA Detection Engine.
Partner with FLM teams and other Monitoring Execution team members for alert detection strategy development, testing and implementation.
Work in close partnership with Wells Fargo Technology on the design, development, testing and implementation of alert detection strategies to support robust supervision, oversight and surveillance capabilities across Consumer Banking
Partner with CBAA Team for Platform initiatives, enhancement, prod fixes and other tasks.
Amenable to work on a mid-schedule (5:00PM - 2:00AM) and be located at McKinley Hill, Taguig

We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.

Drug and Alcohol Policy

Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.

Title: Senior Analyst - Data Governance
CompanyDetails: JLL ¬∑ Taguig, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 week ago ¬∑ 1 applicant
JobDescription:
About the job
Job Description

This position will perform data analysis and be accountable for tasks across multiple accounts. This position will be involved in managing an accounts property portfolio information within JLL‚Äôs Property Hub application. The candidate will address hands-on data analysis work for which they will take full ownership. The Data Governance Analyst will work closely with other team members as needed to ensure assignments are met, good data quality and to that data is successfully integrated to various applications. The Data Governance Analyst will be responsible for handling Data Help Desk tickets and address ongoing operational support of implemented systems.

This position will report to the Product Support BAU Lead. In addition to the BAU activities, the analyst will support the deployments of Property products managed by other teams.

The Data Governance Analyst ‚ÄìProduct Support will contribute to data governance and guidance for data migration and product deployment personnel. This person will work closely with the data governance leaders assigned to various regions, business lines, markets and client accounts to understand best practices, JLL data standards and policies, and the product features that will be offered to users.

What this job involves:

Specifically, this position will

Provide a single point of contact for data governance analyst activities relating to Property BAU support and Data Help Desk tickets. 
Maintain account playbooks that document system processes and standards. 
Work with Account, Data Governance and Data Management leads to ensure that data quality metric standards are met and adhered after account go-live (Transitions) and on an on-going basis (Data Help Desk tickets). 
Provide input to existing and new data standards. 
Work closely with on-account teams to gather all data needs, including mastered data, while adhering to data standards. 
Must handle multiple tasks, manage time effectively, and establish priorities to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and changing team environment
Perform additional job duties and support special projects as assigned, which will include but not be limited to data remediation issues. 
Provide clear, up-to-date status on all work items
Be responsible for issue resolution of supported systems during daily operations. 
Be responsible for oversight of data integration, data flows and downstream impact, primarily as they relate to BAU and potential impact to the account. 
Maintain data quality of assigned Property Hub centralized accounts, weekly reconciliation of data issues. 
Ensure integrated data is maintain to data quality standards. Follow all procedures and best practices when integrating data between systems and maintain periodic reviews and remediation. 
Process property records ons, offs and decommissioning of Property Hub portals when needed. 
Work with data governance peers to adhere to compliance policies and procedures. 
Participate in product testing for any requested enhancements to ensure a quality solution. 
Provide training/ education for product users to properly govern the data for quality and protection. 
Capture and transfer user requests for system and process enhancements related to data standards and quality. 
Assist in documentation of business processes and standard operations in support of the BAU data governance and stewardship operations for deployed products. 

Interested? An ideal candidate would need to have the following qualifications:

Clear communicator both verbal and written
Have good organization and time management skills
Demonstrates a willingness to learn and be independent thinkers
Someone able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment
Possess the highest standards of behavior, collaboration, and work ethics. 
This role requires working with limited supervision while supporting the team to ensure the clients will receive successful results. 
Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills

If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt meet all the requirements. We‚Äôre interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

About JLL

We‚Äôre JLL‚Äîa leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We‚Äôre using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we‚Äôre honoured to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we‚Äôre headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together.

Title: Data Analyst | Makati
CompanyDetails: MedGrocer ¬∑ Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 month ago ¬∑ 58 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
MedGrocer's digitally-enabled "medicine-as-a-service" platforms are used by hundreds of employers and pharma companies. Our end-to-end medicine/vaccine programs, telehealth services, and onsite medical staff serve a million Filipinos every year. MedGrocer is one of the more established Filipino Health Tech startups.

The Data Analyst supports various teams and initiatives with insights gained from data. They analyze complex datasets to identify opportunities for product development and process improvement.

Key Responsibilities

Learn and use statistical tools to collect, clean, and analyze complex datasets
Ideate and implement solutions that address gaps and improve our services and processes
Create models that assess the outcomes of different courses of action
Develop reports and communicate insights to MedGrocer and its stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant data from various sources to ensure the accuracy and completeness of collected data

Why MedGrocer?

Progress: To work on projects that involve statistical analysis, which enables you to hone your skills in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing complex datasets. You will be able to have ownership over your work and have a chance to be exposed to opportunities that could enhance your capabilities in creating data-informed decisions
Purpose: To design and implement an impact in the digitally enabled platform to provide end-to-end care in the form of integrating onsite medical services and 24/7 teleconsultations in order to enhance the lives of millions of Filipinos
People: To both work and have fun with a group of dynamic and passionate individuals from diverse backgrounds, from whom you will create bonds with and have the chance to learn from

Minimum Qualifications

It is preferred but not required to have the following qualifications:

A degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or any related field 
Knowledge in advanced statistical techniques
Knowledge in machine learning techniques and their application
Experience in using programming languages (e.g. SQL, R, Python) for data analysis

JobDescription:
About the job
VCC Link, Inc. was established in 2004 primarily as a firm that offers solutions to offshore and outsourcing companies, addressing business needs such as the supply of quality workforce, customer service training, and turnkey solutions set up.

Champion contributor for the Philippines Information Technology and Business Process Management (IT-BPM) sector, VCC Link has now focused on providing recruitment solutions to the outsourcing industry.

Multi-award-winning, VCC Link provides top-tier solutions to its Fortune Global 500 clients. We offer bespoke, agile, and efficient strategies to help fulfill your workforce needs across all functions in corporate, consulting, operations, and technology verticals.

With over 8,000 life-changing career opportunities served, VCC Link is a professional partner to job seekers looking for career advancement. We support, with compassion, employment opportunities to fresh graduates, supervisors, top-level management, and C-Suite decision-makers.

Our goal: to spark the flow of 100,000 improved lives through better jobs by 2030. Empowering lives since 2004, this is what we do.

IT Infrastructure, Automation, and Data Analytics Hiring

We specialize in supporting roles for Information & Technology Demand with almost every technology covered with unrivaled candidate placements for different IT Verticals such as ERP roles, Software Development and Automation, Data Analytics, Database Management, IT Support Infrastructure, and so much more. Our consultants are industry specialists with in-depth understanding of the IT job market. With passionate expertise, we provide excellent IT hiring experience.

BPM Operations, Corporate & Consulting Solutions

We augment the gap of our client‚Äôs hiring needs by providing quality candidates through a process that we have professionally designed. We deliver highly qualified talents in the areas of Finance and Accounting, Human Resources, Training and Development, Digital Marketing, Legal and Compliance, Facilities and Engineering, Supply Chain, and Risk Compliance ‚Äì servicing multiple Industries from E-Commerce, FinTech, Social Media, Travel, Healthcare, Insurance, Manufacturing and a lot more. Here at VCC Link, we provide only the best among the best of talents.

BPO Expert and Multilingual Hiring

Several industries like Healthcare, Travel, Finance, Sales, and Telecommunications, are in need of diverse support. At VCC Link, our BPO Expert Team is committed to continuously forecast and match applicants‚Äô expectations with what our multinational clients can offer. Through innovative sourcing methods, we not only help candidates land jobs - we empower our clients by providing them access to a workforce of high caliber.

The Role

Ready for a New Adventure? Join Us

Job Scope Overview

Data Gathering and Management: Data Mining, Statistics, Collection, Organizing, and Analyzing Data to identify patterns, trends, and insights for improvement. Implements data control and maintains knowledge of emerging technologies.
Reporting and Coordination: Communicates findings to clients, presents reports, and coordinates data transfer to other departments. Assists with ad hoc projects as assigned.

Ideal Profile

Qualifications Overview

Graduate of BS Math, BS Computer Science, Data Science, Business, Statistics or other related field. 
At least 3 years or above of Work Experience in People Management and Extensive Work Background in Data Analytics.
Hands-on Work Experience in: Data Mining, Statistical Analysis, Reports/Dashboard Creation (using tools like Power BI, Excel, Google Sheets/Google Data Studios, etc.) and Reports Presentation to Clients.
Highly Proficient in English Communication Skills, Work Experience with SQL Querying/Scripting and ETL would be great as well.

What's on Offer?

Earn Up to PHP 150K (Specially, if relevant expertise and experience are strong)
Hybrid (Makati), DAYSHIFT, Flexi.
Work Environment that fosters Growth and Development

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: goFLUENT ¬∑ Quezon City, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 week ago ¬∑ 1 applicant
JobDescription:
About the job
goFLUENTs Commitment and Mission

When we talk about hyper-personalized solutions, we truly deliver corporate language training tailored to an organizations unique goals and needs. Since 2000, weve helped millions of people from different industries and locations become better communicators in business languages.

At goFLUENT, every employee works towards the same goal: to make language training accessible, relevant, and effective for every business and learner. Our diverse and multi-talented global teams are always working together to deliver excellent service.

About The Role

Were looking for a Sr. Data Analyst who will be a part of a growing team focused on understanding & analyzing data, creating visualizations & reports, and discovering insights that can help drive business decisions and provide solutions.

In line with our mission, you will have the opportunity to be exposed to a dynamic and international environment by collaborating with different departments across the organization and providing key data that help the business run efficiently.

Responsibilities

Strategy: Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports
Collaboration: Work together with Database and Tech teams and contribute to the shaping of the businesss data infrastructure
Data Management: Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) data and build data sources based on stakeholders requests
Data Visualization: Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources, and present findings in a clear and concise way by creating dashboards and visualizations


Youll Love This Job if You

Have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Have good English communication skills (verbal and written)
Have a keen attention to detail
Are driven and self-motivated


What Were Looking For

Proven work experience as a data analyst/business data analyst for at least 3 years
Knowledge and experience in Tableau or any BI Visualization tool, and R/Python
Knowledge of statistics, advanced experience using Excel and basic SQL queries
At least a Bachelor's/College Degree in any quantitative field
Willing to work in Eastwood City, Quezon City
Should be a Filipino citizen or hold relevant residence status


What Youll Love In GoFLUENT

Our culture is unlike anywhere else. Starting day one of your , tons of awesome perks and benefits await you, including:

Dynamic, startup-like experience within the security of a fast-growing, 20-year-old Swiss-based company.
Learn from top executives and visionaries in the learning and language market. 
The experience of joining an innovative organization with an international, vibrant working environment.
Full onboarding and fast ramp mentoring program leading candidates to success.
World-class learning experience by being a goFLUENT learner. Learn from one of our twelve business languages!
Exciting global team-building events abroad.


goFLUENT is an equal opportunity employer, so by working with us, youll be part of an organization that supports diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Title: Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Xurpas Enterprise ¬∑ Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 month ago ¬∑ 29 applicants
JobDetails: PHP540,000/yr - PHP1,080,000/yr Hybrid Full-time Entry level
JobDescription:
About the job
At Xurpas Enterprise, we are driven by our goal to help organizations of all sizes successfully implement their digital transformation. We offer ready-made business solutions, custom software development, and IT staff outsourcing.

Our consultative, end-to-end process ensures that we provide the best possible solution to address your requirements.

The Role

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Develops, edits, and maintains IT performance measures and reports, as well as studies and internal business reports such as dashboards with key performance indicators for division-level reporting and decision-making.
Additional information: The position is assigned complex, journey-level assignments. The position works with stakeholders and customers to develop, edit, and ensure the ongoing maintenance of performance measures and reports such as maintaining the performance management repository, documenting method of calculation, method of collection, data source, etc.
Reviews and evaluates performance measures, data sources, methods of calculation, and methods of collection and makes recommendations for improvement to business practices.
Additional information: The position reviews the performance management repository and all of the performance measures of the team including documented methods of calculation, methods of collection, and data sources, and makes recommendations for improving the quality and accuracy of performance measures and reports, as well as the functions they measure or report on.
Researches, develops, and recommends measures to assess business problems and practices.
Additional information: Research, develop, and analyze ad hoc or other measures necessary to assess nonroutine business problems that require more understanding by executive leadership to resolve. This may include working with the Management to develop necessary reporting tools to complete the assignment and provide the needed information.
Communicates with stakeholders to ensure participation in the development of internal measures and performance reports.
Additional information: The position will be responsible for ensuring data is accurate and meets the needs of the team, this includes communicating with the group to ensure business requirements are gathered, as well as
coordinating with data owners to ensure the data is reputable and is an accurate reflection of the intended measure.
Informs management of results and recommendations from IT division performance reports and studies.
Additional information: Presents as necessary on research and data analysis results, routine reports, and ad hoc assignments. Audience may include IT management.
Ensures measures meet or exceed industry standards.
Additional information: The position may attend conferences, meet with counterparts at other agencies, research online, and follow emerging trends to ensure the performance measures and reporting tools are efficient, effective, and contemporary, meeting current industry standards.

Ideal Profile

Extensive experience with various Microsoft workstation Technologies (installation, administration, patching, tuning) particularly Microsoft Windows XP Professional, Windows 7, and Windows 10 Operating Systems
Knowledge of Unicenter Software Delivery (alias ITCM) or SSCM (or similar) and Asset Management experience preferred
Knowledge performance analysis.
Considerable knowledge of data analysis.
Programming/scripting experience required:

>Perl

>Powershell

>Power BI/SAP BI and other Business intelligence tools

>Login Group Policies scripting for AD

>VBScript

>VB.net

>ASP

>Advanced skill in MS Excel

>ActiveX Data Objects and basic ANSI SQL knowledge

>ADSI & WMI

>DOS batch scripting

>JavaScript

Creating unattended installations using MSI and InstallShield & customizing User State Migration Tool
Knowledgeable with Active Directory (with emphasis on Group Policies)
Knowledgeable with SQL Server preferred (installation and administration level)
Project management experience a plus
Amenable to work 3x a week onsite in Alabang, Muntinlupa

What's on Offer?

laptop to be provided (pickup from Makati Office)
Upon regularization 30 paid leaves per year
Upon regularization HMO for you PLUS 1 dependent worth P150,000

Title: Data Analyst

JobDescription:
About the job
Who is Expro?

Working for our clients across the entire well life cycle, Expro is a visionary full-cycle energy services expert offering novel, insightful solutions, dependable competency and award-winning safety.

Combining innovative, future-facing technology with high-quality data across well construction, well flow management and production, subsea well access, and well integrity and intervention, we have a reputation for extraordinary performance that keeps our clients operations running smoothly.

Expro Group are currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the Well Intervention team based in Manila .

Overall Purpose of the Job

To provide Cased Hole data analysis and interpretation expertise to operations for internal and external clients. To enhance the reputation and extend the capability of Expro Cased Hole Services through the delivery of high quality analysis and support to both internal and external clients for operations and Business Development.

Key Activities And Accountabilities

Log Analysis

Job Planning
Liaise with clients and operational departments to determine survey objectives and offer advice on how to achieve
Ensure all relevant information required for analysis is identified and requested to be made available Job execution
Ensure that data received is suitable for processing/modelling
Process data to give a true representation of downhole conditions
Write data processing, modelling and interpretation reports as per client requirements After job
Discuss reports with operations team, including field engineer involved in the data gathering process
Check that reports are delivered to client and clients are satisfied with the service provided
Liaise with clients & operations team to discuss and present analysis summary/report
Ensure data is archived as per QA procedures and all paperwork is complete

Operations Support

Maintain & developed relationships with clients & operations team
Instruct field engineers & operation team on data gathering techniques and methods used to quality check recorded data
Assist with operation teams for client visits and data/analysis presentations when required
Perform in accordance with the Expro HSEQC policies and procedures at all times, and reviewing the safety implications of any recommendations arising

SafeWells Support 

Maintain & developed relationships with clients & SafeWells team 
To provide support to new and existing clients of Expro‚Äôs SafeWells software.(install, configuration, population, support and training)
To support SafeWells customers and the software development team in providing high quality software and customer services in accordance with our quality management system. 

Business Development Support 

Maintain & developed relationships with clients & BD team
Support BD team for client visits, presentations & ITT preparation when required

Job Knowledge And Qualifications

Engineering or Scientific graduate in Petroleum Engineering, Well Technology or a related discipline or relevant industry experience.

Analytical & interpretative skills / expertise in:

Production Logging
Well integrity
Pressure transients
Well intervention design, planning and operations
run simulation

Why Expro?

People are the most important. And every Expro person engineers our future. They are the drivers of our methodologies. Expro people are confident. They can draw out the right answer which attract the right clients.

At Expro, we live by our values, People, Performance, Planet and Partnerships. People are always at the heart of our success. Performance is getting it right first time, every time. We're committed to reducing our environmental impact and we build relationships with our customers to understand their needs.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
CompanyDetails: WebBeds ¬∑ Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 2 months ago ¬∑ 26 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Who are WebBeds?

WebBeds is the fastest growing and most significant accommodation supplier to the travel industry. We are a global company offering ground services (hotels, transfers, tours, activities) to travel professionals. Our products help our partners and customers to create amazing Travel experiences.

Our Products range from a Retail Online platform, Integration Connectivity hub and distribution APIs to name but a few and our systems are 100% cloud hosted processing up to 5.0bn search requests daily. We deliver amazing outcomes using leading edge technology through innovative and creative thinking.

WebBeds is a subsidiary of Webjet Limited (ASX: WEB) ‚Äì an ASX 200 listed company operating a global digital travel business.

What makes us stand out?

We are a wholesale global travel organisation
We have 1500+ people speaking 50+ languages in 120+ cites across 50+ countries 
We partner with over 430,000 properties in more than 15,000 destinations 
We work with more than 44,000 travel companies in 139 source markets 
We have an amazing Technology team focused on delivering valuable outcomes using innovative tech and creative & lateral thinking

Job Purpose

The Business Intelligence Analyst at WebBeds plays a critical role in driving data-driven decision-making and providing actionable insights to support business strategy and operations. The purpose of this role is to gather, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities that will enable informed business decisions.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply advanced analytical techniques, and leverage business intelligence tools to deliver meaningful reports, dashboards, and recommendations. By effectively translating data into actionable insights, the Business Intelligence Analyst contributes to the overall success and growth of the organization.

Key Responsibilities

Provide stakeholders essential reports as needed for business decisions.
Gather, safekeep, and archive necessary data.
Mine data from database by writing and testing SQL scripts to produce data output as needed.
Develop and implement strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Create, introduce, and maintain high-level to entry-level performance reports/dashboards.
Perform in-depth analysis from transactional sources and share insights to stakeholders.
Analyze results and share output to the stakeholders.
Provide support to stakeholders and monitor all requirements for various value-added service.
Administer CRM tool and telephony system by managing automation rules, users, groups/queue, etc. 
Attend to service desk tickets.

Key Measures

Data Accuracy: Ensure that data analysis and reporting are conducted with a high level of accuracy, minimizing errors or inconsistencies in data sets.
Data Insights: Generate meaningful and actionable insights from data analysis, providing valuable information that contributes to informed decision-making.
Timeliness of Reporting: Deliver reports, dashboards, and data-driven recommendations within agreed-upon timelines, meeting the needs and expectations of stakeholders.
Stakeholder Satisfaction: Receive positive feedback from stakeholders regarding the usefulness, relevance, and clarity of the insights and reports provided.
Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and informative data visualizations that effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders.
Technical Proficiency: Demonstrate proficiency in utilizing business intelligence tools, data analysis techniques, and programming languages to effectively analyze and visualize data.
Problem-Solving Skills: Proactively identify and solve complex business problems using data-driven approaches and analytical thinking.
Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, such as IT, Customer Service, and Transformation teams as well as business stakeholders, to gather requirements, understand business needs, and deliver insights.
Continuous Learning and Development: Show commitment to staying updated with industry trends, advancements in business intelligence tools and techniques, and actively seek opportunities to improve skills and knowledge through professional development activities.
Adherence to any departmental or individual KPI‚Äôs and objectives.

Job Qualifications

Good understanding on database structure concepts.
Advanced knowledge of SQL.
Advanced knowledge of PowerBI. 
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel. 
 Advanced knowledge of MS PowerPoint. 
Proven experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst or similar role, with a strong grasp of data analysis and business intelligence concepts.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex data and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

Why choose us as your next destination?

We are super proud of our dedicated team of friendly, energetic & passionate professionals. Our people are key to the success of our business & everybody at WebBeds has their own unique role to play as we continue to drive the company forward.

Over 50 different languages are spoken by our workforce, but whether working from offices in Dubai or London or out in the field in Johannesburg or Buenos Aires, we all share the common goal to take pride in what we do & to deliver our partners with unbeatable service & support.

International highly skilled group of experts from all around the globe üåé
Dynamic environment with the chance to grow, influence & impact change ‚ö°
Disruptive, fast-growing market leader within travel & endless possibilities üíº
Culture built on collaborationü§ù empowerment and innovation üí°

Title: Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Emotive ¬∑ Metro Manila 3 weeks ago ¬∑ 10 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
About This Role:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join the team that will take ownership of building out our data insights and infrastructure across the entire organization. In this role, you will report directly to our Manager of Revenue Operations and partner with our Co-founders, executives and department stakeholders to provide crucial data insights. You will be working across the business enabling the team to make sense out of their data and inform business decisions.

How You Will Contribute:

Manage the data pipeline roadmap in collaboration with engineering platform team
Build out connections to external data platforms such as Segment.io, Salesforce, Gainsight, Looker etc. from scratch
Perform ad-hoc analysis to predict, measure, and interpret business trends
Collect data from various systems, synthesizing that data into valuable insights
Create, maintain and monitor the critical business health metrics to help our mission teams with the information they need to make decisions
Partner with department heads to build out dashboards and reporting to increase visibility of company data to better inform business decisions 
Investigate and navigate through data complexity to identify what story the data is telling us
Proactively surface and provide recommendations from a reporting and dashboard perspective to provide visibility into unknown questions

Skills You Will Bring:

Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Engineering, Statistics, Math or related field required 
3+ years of experience in financial analysis, sales analytics, or an equivalent analytical role
Strong SQL skills - you're comfortable getting down and dirty with databases and enjoy pulling data and numbers
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Segment, Looker and building out charts, graphs and tables in those tools (Experience with Gainsight or Metabase is a huge plus)
Experience in the field of Business Operations and/or Sales Strategy in either a large consulting firm or technology company ‚Äì ecommerce experience preferred
Collaborative and team oriented - Emotive has a Team Over Self culture and we are building a team that supports one another and shares best practices
Experience with Python is a huge plus!

If hired for this position in California, the compensation range for this position is between $70,000-$95,000. The compensation may vary depending on your location, skills and experience. The compensation package may also include additional incentive compensation opportunities in the form of discretionary annual bonus or commissions, plus equity incentives. This information is provided per the California Pay Transparency Law.

The Emotive Story

At Emotive, our vision is an internet that is more human. Since our launch in 2018, Emotive has become the product of choice for over 1,000 eCommerce companies to drive more sales and build more personal relationships with customers.

We're extraordinarily proud of the company we've built. We're a driven, passionate, responsible group that values personal and professional growth equally. We take care of ourselves, our families, our customers, and one another. We believe in sustainable and diverse approaches to work and life, because optimizing for the long-term is the best path to success.

Diversity & Inclusion at Emotive

Emotive is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

About the job
Job Description

This position will perform data analysis and be accountable for tasks across multiple accounts. This position will be involved in managing an accounts property portfolio information within JLL‚Äôs Property Hub application. The candidate will address hands-on data analysis work for which they will take full ownership. The Data Governance Analyst will work closely with other team members as needed to ensure assignments are met, good data quality and to that data is successfully integrated to various applications. The Data Governance Analyst will be responsible for handling Data Help Desk tickets and address ongoing operational support of implemented systems.

This position will report to the Product Support BAU Lead. In addition to the BAU activities, the analyst will support the deployments of Property products managed by other teams.

The Data Governance Analyst ‚ÄìProduct Support will contribute to data governance and guidance for data migration and product deployment personnel. This person will work closely with the data governance leaders assigned to various regions, business lines, markets and client accounts to understand best practices, JLL data standards and policies, and the product features that will be offered to users.

What this job involves:

Specifically, this position will

Provide a single point of contact for data governance analyst activities relating to Property BAU support and Data Help Desk tickets. 
Maintain account playbooks that document system processes and standards. 
Work with Account, Data Governance and Data Management leads to ensure that data quality metric standards are met and adhered after account go-live (Transitions) and on an on-going basis (Data Help Desk tickets). 
Provide input to existing and new data standards. 
Work closely with on-account teams to gather all data needs, including mastered data, while adhering to data standards. 
Must handle multiple tasks, manage time effectively, and establish priorities to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and changing team environment
Perform additional job duties and support special projects as assigned, which will include but not be limited to data remediation issues. 
Provide clear, up-to-date status on all work items
Be responsible for issue resolution of supported systems during daily operations. 
Be responsible for oversight of data integration, data flows and downstream impact, primarily as they relate to BAU and potential impact to the account. 
Maintain data quality of assigned Property Hub centralized accounts, weekly reconciliation of data issues. 
Ensure integrated data is maintain to data quality standards. Follow all procedures and best practices when integrating data between systems and maintain periodic reviews and remediation. 
Process property records ons, offs and decommissioning of Property Hub portals when needed. 
Work with data governance peers to adhere to compliance policies and procedures. 
Participate in product testing for any requested enhancements to ensure a quality solution. 
Provide training/ education for product users to properly govern the data for quality and protection. 
Capture and transfer user requests for system and process enhancements related to data standards and quality. 
Assist in documentation of business processes and standard operations in support of the BAU data governance and stewardship operations for deployed products. 

Interested? An ideal candidate would need to have the following qualifications:

Clear communicator both verbal and written
Have good organization and time management skills
Demonstrates a willingness to learn and be independent thinkers
Someone able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment
Possess the highest standards of behavior, collaboration, and work ethics. 
This role requires working with limited supervision while supporting the team to ensure the clients will receive successful results. 
Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills

To support this, we are hiring for roles across Sales, Product, Development, Marketing and other functions. Visit our Careers page to see our complete listings and more information on our competitive benefits package.

Data developers and data analysts in Rimes, the data team work together to offer hundreds of cloud-based financial databases, across multiple asset classes, to meet the fast-growing data requirements from global institutional clients.

Data developers at Rimes build new data acquisition, processing incoming financial data feeds and load it onto Rimes platform. They also participate in the analysis of client data requirements and develop customized reporting processes.

Data analysts are responsible to monitor and maintain existing data processes and databases in Rimes platform.

Both data developers and data analysts are expected to be knowledgeable in global financial market data and be able to work collaboratively with other teams worldwide. Rimes' hand-off management style encourages developers and analysts to take initiative to complete projects, managing multiple tasks, as well as set their own individual day-to-day priorities.

You are:

Flexible, enthusiastic and display a positive attitude 
Able to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlines 
Happy to work on your own initiative 
Interested in technology, but also aware of the need for appropriate processes and procedures
Attentive to detail, but also able to demonstrate a wide degree of creativity 
A confident communicator with exceptional interpersonal skills 

Areas of Responsibility:

Support the suite of Rimes products and services
Monitoring data processes and reporting
Data collection and verification
Databases maintenance

The Data Analyst (Operations) must:

Have previous work experience in the financial data industry
Bachelor or Master in finance, science, engineering or related fields
Ability to analyze and solve problems
Work independently, results driven & detail oriented
Flexible and efficient at multitasking assignments
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English

Also useful:

Python/Perl
Knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of financial markets and financial data

Candidates must be authorized to work in the Philippines.

Rimes is committed to promote the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business. Whether it's through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances.

Title: Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Afterglow Events and Product Management Consultancy Inc. ¬∑ Quezon City, National Capital Region, Philippines 2 months ago ¬∑ 12 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
At Afterglow Events and Product Management Consultancy Inc., we create the best events and experiences for your brand. We love working with companies who are committed to making a difference, and we're dedicated to helping you get there.

At Afterglow, we believe that your brand's success is our mission. That's why we offer a full suite of services to help you reach your goals.

We offer digital marketing expertise that covers a wide range of services, including social media management, content marketing, email campaigns, pay-per-click (PPC) advertising, and search engine optimization (SEO). We harness the power of the digital realm to connect your brand with your ideal customers.

Our branding and design team designs compelling brand identities that shine through every piece of marketing collateral. From logo design to brand messaging‚Äîand everything in between‚Äîwe make sure your personality shines through every piece of creative collateral you produce.

Our creative team dreams up innovative and captivating campaigns that drive engagement with your audience. We think outside the box to create memorable experiences for them.

Data-driven decisions lead to successful outcomes; that's why we conduct in-depth market research to understand your target audience, competitors, and industry trends before creating well-informed strategies for each campaign or project you entrust us with.

The Role

Data Analyst play a key role in deciphering complex data sets to drive informed decision-making. As a Data Analyst at AfterGlow, you will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data, using cutting-edge tools and techniques. Your insights will guide our business strategies, optimize processes, and fuel innovation. If you have a strong analytical mindset and a knack for turning data into meaningful solutions, we invite you to be part of our data-driven journey.

Duties And Responsibilities

Execute, and prepare the basic data statistics report daily, weekly and monthly report 
Convert the data from the database using power query with the help of the 3rd Party platform and arrange the data accordingly on its correct campaign 
Communicate with the development team for the data required for statistics 
Basic Data Analysis - provides analysis, findings, interprets data, using statistical techniques. 
Interprets trends or patterns and assist with the decision-making reference on the operation strategies 
Other tasks assigned by the supervisor. 

Ideal Profile

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline. 
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) for data manipulation and statistical analysis. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract actionable insights from complex datasets. 
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to present findings effectively. 
Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy. 
Effective communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders. 
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. 
An understanding of database management and data warehousing concepts is a plus. 
Experience with machine learning and predictive analytics is preferred but not required. 
A passion for data and a desire to stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies. 

What's on Offer?

Work alongside & learn from best in class talent
Excellent career development opportunities
Attractive salary & benefits

Title: Senior Social Insights Analyst (Contract)
CompanyDetails: VaynerMedia ¬∑ Metro Manila 1 month ago ¬∑ 5 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
What's up? We're VaynerMedia! We are a contemporary global creative and media agency with an expertise in driving relevance for clients and delivering impactful business results. The independently-owned agency was founded in 2009 and has offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Japan and Mexico City. VaynerMedia has been recognized for its work at Cannes Lions, the Clio Awards and The Webby Awards. It is part of the VaynerX family of companies.

Culture is our key and Empathy is how we build it. VaynerMediaAPAC is strong with a world-class combination of diverse backgrounds collaborating to put forward innovative, creative and strategic solutions to the one advantage that stands the test of time --- PEOPLE. Day in and day out, we propel some of the biggest brands in the world to the intersection of attention and culture. In APAC, we are proudly +200, servicing a diverse client all around the region.

WE are searching the Philippines landscape for a Senior Social Insights Analyst that will be an expert in research and analysis while interested to dive into the trend-spotting areas such as index scoring and validation.

Research & Analysis

You will be responsible for hosting discovery sessions with the agency's clients to understand the business and marketing needs and report or research objectives
You will translate this into constructed queries and research or report plan that will monitor the social conversation for clients' brands, competitive brands, Influencers, programs, products, marketing campaigns, and events. 
You will deep dive into the data to uncover drivers of social buzz, then translate the data into a compelling story. 
You're accountable for deciphering what is important, meaningful data and then communicating the concise story in a way that allows the business to make decisions based on the reports. 

Trend Spotting

You will monitor emerging trends daily through social listening or desktop research to share underpriced opportunities to clients
You will be responsible for owning methodology and collecting trend sources for your market and create a semi-automated workflow that can pickup daily social triggers

THE TASK AT HAND

Consult stakeholders on topic definitions, social listening measures and filters to define objectives and set deliverables for standard and custom reports. 
Implement social analysis for campaigns/events and present insights back to inform content /Media decisions for campaign/event activities and advise on actions to take from optimizations standpoint. 
Social listening tool setup including building queries using query parameters, and dashboards on given social listening tools or social analytics tools. 
Take initiative on the refinement of query parameter setup to ensure accurate and insightful mention analysis is available to report on by the end of the reporting period. 
Pull and interpret data from social listening tools including volume, sentiment, conversation drivers, influencers, and 'unobvious' observations and insight etc. 
Create and edit reporting deliverables for Google slides, Newsletter and Excel formats that transform social data into a clear story. Visualize findings legibly using charts, tables, and infographics, and provide actionable insights based on concrete data. 
At times be the direct client contact for regional projects and coordinate work amongst junior analysts
Manage a deliverable calendar of recurring scheduled and ad hoc reports. 
Good housekeeping - upkeep of shared calendars and the storage of report agreement documents and delivered reports. 

Qualifications

3-4 years of professional experience social media marketing, social media analytics, and measurements, social listening or social media management or community management
Minimum 2 years of experience in online/social analytics
Moderate experience in client communications and managing their expectations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and proven ability to transform data into a concise, yet compelling story. 
Ability to synthesize information and produce insightful and accurate analysis and recommendations. 
Good mix of technical understanding, business sense, managerial/connecting and Interpersonal skills
Strong familiarity and understanding of social media platforms such as YouTube, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Chat applications, is required. 
Relevant experience pulling data from social media listening/analytics tools such as Brandwatch, Sprinklr, Meltwater, Google Studio, etc. 

What You Should Know About VaynerMedia

Think "lab" and not "agency". We get excited about solving business problems, not creating advertising for the sake of making advertising. Our entrepreneurship DNA runs deep. We're willing to break rules, try new things, and test hypotheses if it means better understanding our craft. It's fun!

Our environment (and pace) feels much more like a start-up than most agencies you might be used to. Hopefully that, and the opportunity to collaborate with the talented and enthusiastic crew, work with big brands excites you, as it does us. We can't wait to meet you.
